# machinelearning

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of the package machinelearningis to support the readers of the
book “Künstliche Intelligenz und Machine Learning mit R” with samples, functions and tutorials
as described in the book.

The function ml.summary() automatically evaluates the main descriptive statistical figures 
for a variable and creates different forms of graphics for qualitative and quantitative variables.

## Installation

You can install the development version of machinelearning from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("bheesen/machinelearning")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(machinelearning)
```

What is special about using `README.Rmd` instead of just `README.md`?
You can include R chunks like so:

``` r
ergebnis<-ml.summary(autos$PS,"Autos","PS",box=T)
ergebnis
```
